settings.title:
The World’s
Smartest Coffee.
settings.text:
We took everything you love about coffee, removed what you don’t, and added supplements to unlock your peak performance.

75mg per serving (35% less than a drip coffee)

Taste

Light and creamy medium roast coffee with subtle notes of cocoa.

Feeling

Lab Tested

We test for purity, heavy metals, allergens, mycotoxins, and mold.

Increases bioavailability of beta-glucans, triterpenes, triterpenoids, and sterols in our functional mushrooms.

No B.S.

We use the cleanest ingredients only. No starch. No myceliated oats.
settings.text1: Full Ingredient List: NEUBRAIN Mushroom Blend(Lion’s Mane, Cordyceps, Turkey Tail, Chaga, & Reishi),Coffee Extract, L-Theanine, L-Tyrosine, Alpha GPC, Collagen Peptides. Nothing else.

settings.question: Lion’s Mane
settings.title: LION’S MANE MUSHROOM (DOUBLE-EXTRACTED, 100% FRUITING BODY)
settings.text:
The only mushroom with nootropic properties, Lion's Mane mushroom stimulates nerve growth factor (NGF), which in turn promotes brain plasticity, brain regeneration, memory, focus, mood balance, and overall brain health.*

Double Extracted, 100% Fruiting Body.
settings.answer:
Lion’s Mane Mushroom has been linked to significant cognitive improvements that declined after supplementation ended.

Bioactivities: The Lion's Mane Mushroom (Yamabushitake) contributes to brain health and provides active nootropics named hericenones and erinacines. Clinical studies imply that the consumption of Lion's Mane can boost the production of the Nerve Growth Factor (NGF), which may aid in neural regeneration and myelin nerve sheath synthesis. Elevated levels of NGF can improve brain plasticity, enabling better retention of new information and memories, while also encouraging the growth of healthy brain cells and supporting optimal brain cell membrane function. 

Benefits: The results of a double-blind, placebo-controlled trial indicated a significant improvement in cognitive function among adults aged 50 to 80 with mild cognitive impairment after ceasing to consume Lion's Mane Mushroom. Additionally, the clinical trial researchers suggested that consuming this type of mushroom may also help to maintain a balanced mood.
settings.answer1:
• Wong KH, et al. Neuroregenerative potential of lion's mane mushroom, Hericium erinaceus (Bull.: Fr.) Pers. (higher Basidiomycetes), in the treatment of peripheral nerve injury (review). Int J Med Mushrooms. 2012;14(5):427-46. 
  • Sabaratnam V, et al. Neuronal Health — Can Culinary and Medicinal Mushrooms Help? J Tradit Complement Med. 2013 Jan-Mar; 3(1): 62–68. 
  • Mori K, et al. Improving effects of the mushroom Yamabushitake (Hericium erinaceus) on mild cognitive impairment: a double-blind placebo-controlled clinical trial. Phytother Res. 2009 Mar;23(3):367-72. doi: 10.1002/ptr.2634. 
  • Mori K, et al. Nerve growth factor-inducing activity of Hericium erinaceus in 1321N1 human astrocytoma cells. Biol Pharm Bull. 2008 Sep;31(9):1727-32. 

Ma BJ, et al. TMYC Hericenones and erinacines: stimulators of nerve growth factor (NGF) biosynthesis in Hericium erinaceus. Mycology, Vol. 1, No. 2, June 2010, 92–98.

settings.question: CORDYCEPS MUSHROOM
settings.title: CORDYCEPS MUSHROOM
settings.text: NeuBrain’s 100% Fruiting Body Cordyceps promotes the function of the adrenal cortex, increases oxygenation and the production of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) in healthy individuals.
settings.answer1:
• Chen, Steve, et al. “Effect of CS-4® (Cordyceps Sinensis) on Exercise Performance in Healthy Older Subjects: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.” The Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine, vol. 16, no. 5, 2010, pp. 585–590., https://doi.org/10.1089/acm.2009.0226. 
  • NAGATA, AKIRA, et al. “Supplemental Anti-Fatigue Effects of Cordyceps Sinensis (Tochu-Kaso) Extract Powder during Three Stepwise Exercise of Human.” Japanese Journal of Physical Fitness and Sports Medicine, vol. 55, no. Supplement, 2006, https://doi.org/10.7600/jspfsm.55.s145. 
  • Geng, Ping, et al. “Antifatigue Functions and Mechanisms of Edible and Medicinal Mushrooms.” BioMed Research International, vol. 2017, 2017, pp. 1–16., https://doi.org/10.1155/2017/9648496. 
  • Noakes, Timothy D. “Maximal Oxygen Uptake as a Parametric Measure of Cardiorespiratory Capacity.” Medicine & Science in Sports & Exercise, vol. 40, no. 3, 2008, p. 585., https://doi.org/10.1249/mss.0b013e3181617350. 

Kumar, Neeraj, et al. “Antigenotoxic Effect of Withania Somnifera (Cordyceps sinensis) Extract against DNA Damage Induced by Hydrogen Peroxide in Cultured Human Peripheral Blood Lymphocytes.” International Journal of Current Microbiology and Applied Sciences, vol. 5, no. 4, 2016, pp. 713–719., https://doi.org/10.20546/ijcmas.2016.504.082.

settings.question: CHAGA MUSHROOM
settings.title: CHAGA MUSHROOM
settings.text: NeuBrain’s 100% Fruiting Body Chaga supplies all of the mushroom’s active constituents, including immune-boosting Beta-D-glucans that stimulate the immune system, and inotodial and ergosterol peroxide to reduce inflammation by regulating the production of cytokines
settings.answer:
Chaga Mushroom has been shown in clinical research to improve immune system functions and reduce inflammation. 

Bioactivities: The Chaga mushroom supports the immune system and reduces inflammation by regulating the production of cytokines and enhancing cellular communication. Chaga also contains high levels of beta-glucans, which are naturally occurring enzymes that can boost the immune system’s defenses. Clinical studies imply that the consumption of Chaga can modulate immune responses through the secretion of cytokines in immune cells and regulates antigen-specific antibody production. Additional research suggests that Chaga exhibits anti-cancer activity by down-regulating the beta-catenin pathways in colorectal cancer. 

Benefits: The results of a controlled clinical study indicated a significant decrease (25.2%) in interleukin cytokines production and an increase (102.4%) in interferon cytokines production. Within the study, serum immunoglobulins and cytokines were measured in concanavalin A splenocytes and T-cells before, and after, the oral administration of Chaga. Overall, Chaga was shown to improve immune defenses and reduce inflammation by regulating antigen-specific antibody production.
settings.answer1:
• Ko, Suk-kyung, et al. “Inonotus Obliquus Extracts Suppress Antigen-Specific IGE Production through the Modulation of th1/th2 Cytokines in Ovalbumin-Sensitized Mice.” Journal of Ethnopharmacology, vol. 137, no. 3, 2011, pp. 1077–1082., https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jep.2011.07.024. 
  • Kang, Ju-Hee, et al. “Ergosterol Peroxide from Chaga Mushroom (Inonotus Obliquus) Exhibits Anti-Cancer Activity by down-Regulation of the β-Catenin Pathway in Colorectal Cancer.” Journal of Ethnopharmacology, vol. 173, 2015, pp. 303–312., https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jep.2015.07.030. 
  • Lull, Cristina, et al. “Antiinflammatory and Immunomodulating Properties of Fungal Metabolites.” Mediators of Inflammation, vol. 2005, no. 2, 2005, pp. 63–80., https://doi.org/10.1155/mi.2005.63. 
  • Akramienė, Dalia, et al. “Effects of ß-Glucans on the Immune System.” Medicina, vol. 43, no. 8, 2007, p. 597., https://doi.org/10.3390/medicina43080076. 

Sang, Rui, et al. “Immunomodulatory Effects ofInonotus ObliquusPolysaccharide on Splenic Lymphocytes Infected withToxoplasma Gondiivia NF-ΚB and MAPKS PATHWAYS.” Immunopharmacology and Immunotoxicology, vol. 44, no. 1, 2021, pp. 129–138., https://doi.org/10.1080/08923973.2021.2017453.

settings.question: REISHI MUSHROOM
settings.title: REISHI MUSHROOM
settings.text: NeuBrian’s 100% Fruiting Body Reishi supplies polypeptides to the body to inform the endorphins and neurotransmitters in the body to reduce stress and promote better sleep.
settings.answer:
Reishi Mushroom has been linked to stress-lowering capabilities through polysaccharides, triterpenoids, and an ability to calm the central nervous system (CNS). 

Bioactivities: The most widely studied herb in the world, the Reishi Mushroom contributes to reduced levels of anxiety and stress through an ability to nourish and calm the central nervous system. Clinical trials have found that after consuming Reishi, patients with neurasthenia – a condition often associated with depression, anxiety, or emotional stress – found a significant reduction in fatigue and an improvement in overall wellbeing. Research suggests that the polysaccharides and triterpenoid enzymes in the mushroom are responsible for its stress-lowering capacity. Additional clinical research has suggested Reishi can reduce sleep onset latency (SOL) and increase the time spent in restful sleep. 

Benefits: The results of multiple double-blind, placebo-controlled studies link Reishi to anxiety- and stress-reducing properties. In one such study, 123 patients experiencing neurasthenia were provided Reishi for a period of eight weeks. After the trial period, the overall sense of well-being among patients increased from 15.5% to 38.7%. In a second study, 48 breast cancer patients undergoing endocrine therapy showed significant improvements in the domains of physical well-being and fatigue subscale after treatment with the mushroom. These patients reported less anxiety and depression and a better quality of life.
settings.answer1:
• Zhao, Hong, et al. “Spore Powder ofGanoderma LucidumImproves Cancer-Related Fatigue in Breast Cancer Patients Undergoing Endocrine Therapy: A Pilot Clinical Trial.” Evidence-Based Complementary and Alternative Medicine, vol. 2012, 2012, pp. 1–8., https://doi.org/10.1155/2012/809614. 
  • Tang, Wenbo, et al. “A Randomized, Double-Blind and Placebo-Controlled Study of aGanoderma LucidumPolysaccharide Extract in Neurasthenia.” Journal of Medicinal Food, vol. 8, no. 1, 2005, pp. 53–58., https://doi.org/10.1089/jmf.2005.8.53. 
  • Cui, Xiang-Yu, et al. “Extract of Ganoderma Lucidum Prolongs Sleep Time in Rats.” Journal of Ethnopharmacology, vol. 139, no. 3, 2012, pp. 796–800., https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jep.2011.12.020. 
  • Chu, Qing-Ping, et al. “Extract of Ganoderma Lucidum Potentiates Pentobarbital-Induced Sleep via a GABAergic Mechanism.” Pharmacology Biochemistry and Behavior, vol. 86, no. 4, 2007, pp. 693–698., https://doi.org/10.1016/j.pbb.2007.02.015. 

Cör, Darija, et al. “Antitumour, Antimicrobial, Antioxidant and Antiacetylcholinesterase Effect of Ganoderma Lucidum Terpenoids and Polysaccharides: A Review.” Molecules, vol. 23, no. 3, 2018, p. 649., https://doi.org/10.3390/molecules23030649.

settings.question: TURKEY TAIL MUSHROOM
settings.title: TURKEY TAIL MUSHROOM
settings.text: NeuBrain’s Turkey Tail delivers prebiotics such as indigestible fibers and polysaccharides to positively regulate the balance of intestinal flora, improving gut health and digestion.
settings.answer:
Bioactivities: Turkey Tail has been linked to improving gut health by promoting the growth of beneficial bacteria that support healthy digestion. Turkey Tail acts as a prebiotic, stimulating the development of good bacteria and regulating the balance of intestinal flora. Clinical studies have found that turkey tail significantly increased the number of helpful bacteria, such as Bifidobacterium and Lactobacillus, while reducing populations of bad bacteria, such as Clostridium and Enterococcus. Having a healthy, balanced gut microbiome is linked to improved digestive health, a strong immune system, and a lower risk of gastrointestinal disorders and diseases.  

Benefits: In one such double-blind, placebo-controlled study, 24 participants were randomized to receive Turkey Tail, amoxicillin, or a placebo to judge the effects of each substance on gut flora. After eight weeks, results showed that turkey tail increased the number of beneficial bacteria and suppressed the growth of potentially harmful bacteria.
settings.answer1:
• Pallav, Kumar, et al. “Effects of Polysaccharopeptide fromTrametes Versicolorand Amoxicillin on the Gut Microbiome of Healthy Volunteers.” Gut Microbes, vol. 5, no. 4, 2014, pp. 458–467., https://doi.org/10.4161/gmic.29558.  
  • Jayachandran, Muthukumaran, et al. “A Critical Review on Health Promoting Benefits of Edible Mushrooms through Gut Microbiota.” International Journal of Molecular Sciences, vol. 18, no. 9, 2017, p. 1934., https://doi.org/10.3390/ijms18091934. 
  • Rinninella, Emanuele, et al. “What Is the Healthy Gut Microbiota Composition? A Changing Ecosystem across Age, Environment, Diet, and Diseases.” Microorganisms, vol. 7, no. 1, 2019, p. 14., https://doi.org/10.3390/microorganisms7010014. 
  • Yu, Zhuo-Teng, et al. “Trametes Versicolor Extract Modifies Human Fecal Microbiota Composition in Vitro.” Plant Foods for Human Nutrition, vol. 68, no. 2, 2013, pp. 107–112., https://doi.org/10.1007/s11130-013-0342-4. 

Stamets, Paul. “Trametes Versicolor (Turkey Tail Mushrooms) and the Treatment of Breast Cancer.” Global Advances in Health and Medicine, vol. 1, no. 5, 2012, pp. 20–20., https://doi.org/10.7453/gahmj.2012.1.5.007.

settings.question: L-THEANINE.
settings.title: L-THEANINE.
settings.text: NeuBrain’s delivers pure L-Theanine to boost Alpha brainwaves while settling excitable neurotransmitters and promoting calming neurotransmitters like serotonin, dopamine, and GABA.
settings.answer:
L-Theanine has been shown in human clinical research to enhance alpha brainwaves. 

Bioactivities: L-Theanine has been found to enhance the activity of alpha brainwaves, which are related to a state of calm alertness and improved creativity. It appears to regulate excitable neurotransmitters and boost the production of calming neurotransmitters such as serotonin, dopamine, and GABA. Researchers have indicated that L-Theanine can modulate the brain's attention circuitry. Additionally, it may also provide protection to neurons from damage, potentially supporting clear cognitive function as one ages. 

Benefits: L-Theanine is known to induce a state of calm and serenity while also enhancing attention, alertness, and focus. It is commonly utilized for activities such as studying, learning new information, creative problem-solving, art, and other tasks that require concentration. Additionally, L-Theanine can mitigate the unpleasant jittery side effects of caffeine consumption
settings.answer1:
• Nobre AC, et al. L-theanine, a natural constituent in tea, and its effect on mental state. Asia Pacific Journal of Clinical Nutrition, 01/2008; 17 Suppl 1:167-8. 
  • Nathan PJ, et al. The neuropharmacology of L-theanine(N-ethyl-L-glutamine): a possible neuroprotective and cognitive enhancing agent. J Herb Pharmacother. 2006;6(2):21-30. 
  • Kimura K, et al. L-Theanine reduces psychological and physiological stress responses. Biol Psychol. 2007 Jan;74(1):39-45. 
  • Gomez-Ramirez M, et al. The deployment of intersensory selective attention: a high-density electrical mapping study of the effects of theanine. Clin Neuropharmacol. 2007 Jan-Feb;30(1):25-38. 

Yamada T. Effects of theanine, r-glutamylethylamide, on neurotransmitter release and its relationship with glutamic acid neurotransmission. Nutr Neurosci. 2005 Aug;8(4):219-26.

settings.question: L-TYROSINE
settings.title: L-TYROSINE
settings.text: NeuBrain’s L-Tyrosine is the best form for brain health – easy to absorb and bioavailable – it delivers more nootropic activity than plain Tyrosine.
settings.answer:
L-Tyrosine was found to enhance mental performance with greater benefits recorded as tasks progressed from easier (1-BACK) to more difficult (2-BACK). 

Bioactivities: L-Tyrosine is an amino acid that helps synthesize catecholamine neurotransmitters crucial for memory, mood, and cognitive processing. These neurotransmitters include dopamine, epinephrine, and norepinephrine. Clinical research indicates that L-Tyrosine may mitigate the effects of stress on the brain and potentially replenish neurotransmitters depleted during periods of high-pressure thinking. 

Benefits: Studies conducted on humans have indicated that L-Tyrosine may improve working memory during multitasking and enhance mental performance under high stress, fatigue, and sleep deprivation.

Besides its reputation as a nootropic for sustaining cognitive function under stress, L-Tyrosine has recently garnered academic interest for its potential to optimize attention and focus.
settings.answer1:
• Thomas JR, et al. Tyrosine improves working memory in a multitasking environment. Pharmacol Biochem Behav. 1999 Nov;64(3):495-500. 
  • Neri DF, et al. The effects of tyrosine on cognitive performance during extended wakefulness. Aviat Space Environ Med. 1995 Apr;66(4):313-9. 
  • Deijen JB, et al. Tyrosine improves cognitive performance and reduces blood pressure in cadets after one week of a combat training course. Brain Res Bull. 1999 Jan 15;48(2):203-9. 
  • Banderet LE, Lieberman HR. Treatment with tyrosine, a neurotransmitter precursor, reduces environmental stress in humans. Brain Res Bull. 1989 Apr;22(4):759-62. 

Colzato LS, et al. Working memory reloaded: tyrosine repletes updating in the N-back task. Front. Behav. Neurosci., 16 December 2013.

settings.question: ALPHA GPC
settings.title: ALPHA GPC (CHOLINE ALFOSCERATE).
settings.text: NeuBrain’s Alpha GPC is the most effective cholinergic in increasing plasma and brain choline levels, as it has better transportation to the brain than choline and CDP-choline
settings.answer:
Alpha GPC delivers choline to the brain, stimulating an important neurotransmitter – acetylcholine - that promotes cognitive health. 

Bioactivities: Able to cross the blood-brain barrier, Alpha GPC is used to improve memory, learning, and thinking skills. It does this by increasing acetylcholine in the brain, a chemical that plays an important role in memory and learning functions. Alpha GPC has been used to improve memory impairment in both healthy individuals as well as those with Alzheimer’s Disease. Additionally, studies show that alpha GPC can boost focus, memory, and learning abilities in young and old patients alike.  

Benefits: Studies conducted on humans indicate that Alpha GPC is more effective in increasing memory, learning, and focus than caffeine and other choline supplements. In a double-blind, placebo-controlled study, 20 participants consumed variations of Alpha-GPC, caffeine, and a placebo. After 30 minutes, individuals were able to reach SST scores 18.1% better and 10.5% faster than without supplementation.
settings.answer1:
• Parker, Adam G, et al. “The Effects of Alpha-Glycerylphosphorylcholine, Caffeine or Placebo on Markers of Mood, Cognitive Function, Power, Speed, and Agility.” Journal of the International Society of Sports Nutrition, vol. 12, no. sup1, 2015, https://doi.org/10.1186/1550-2783-12-s1-p41. 
  • Poly, Coreyann, et al. “The Relation of Dietary Choline to Cognitive Performance and White-Matter Hyperintensity in the Framingham Offspring Cohort.” The American Journal of Clinical Nutrition, vol. 94, no. 6, 2011, pp. 1584–1591., https://doi.org/10.3945/ajcn.110.008938. 
  • De Jesus Moreno Moreno, M. “Cognitive Improvement in Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Dementia after Treatment with the Acetylcholine Precursor Choline Alfoscerate: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Trial.” Clinical Therapeutics, vol. 25, no. 1, 2003, pp. 178–193., https://doi.org/10.1016/s0149-2918(03)90023-3. 
  • DeFina, Philip A., et al. “Alzheimer's Disease Clinical and Research Update for Health Care Practitioners.” Journal of Aging Research, vol. 2013, 2013, pp. 1–9., https://doi.org/10.1155/2013/207178. 

Świąder, Katarzyna, et al. “Influence of Additives on the Physiochemical Properties of Eye Drops Containing Cytidine Diphosphate (CDP)-Choline.” Pharmacological Reports, vol. 65, 2013, p. 92., https://doi.org/10.1016/s1734-1140(13)71396-3.

settings.title: Recommended by top health experts & performers
1% FOR THE PLaNET®
settings.text:
Striving to improve the health of our people and our planet, we are a proud partner of 1% for the Planet®.

1% for the Planet® represents a global network of businesses, individuals, and environmental organizations tackling our planet’s most pressing environmental issues.

FOR EVERY PRODUCT SOLD, NEUBRAIN™ COMMITs 1% OF PROCEEDS TO SAVING THE PLANET.

settings.title: NO KID HUNGRY®
settings.text:
We believe health and nutrition is a human right.

No Kid Hungry® helps provide support, education, and funding to existing local programs that feed kids. They provide this support system by giving grants to programs that work directly to feed kids across the USA in local communities.

For every product sold, NEUBRAIN™ donates to help feed children in need.

settings.title: NEUBRAIN’S PROMISE
settings.text:
We pledge to provide you with clinically measured supplements, crafted from tested, raw, and potent ingredients, free from preservatives, artificial flavors, unneeded fillers, banned substances, or GMOs.

Our products are scientifically formulated, relying on clinical trials to ensure each ingredient serves a precise purpose. You can expect them to work exactly as they say. You should expect results, and we are here to provide them.

If you are not entirely satisfied for any reason, our return policy allows for a refund or exchange within 45 days from the shipping date. Your satisfaction is always our paramount concern.

settings.question: What is NeuBrain?
settings.answer:
NEUBRAIN™ is a matrix of 10 scientifically supported nootropics, adaptogens, and prebiotics. It's designed as a superior alternative to traditional coffee, aiming to optimize your brain and body performance.

Considered the world's smartest coffee, NEUBRAIN™ acts as a comprehensive optimizer for your brain and body, offering support for immediate cognitive function and long-term health.

settings.question: How does NeuBrain work?
settings.answer:
NEUBRAIN™ stands apart from other nootropics and coffee alternatives due to its advanced formulation strategy. It exclusively uses research-backed nootropics, adaptogens, and prebiotics that support nine crucial brand and body pathways: Energy, Brain Chemicals, Blood Flow, Brainwaves, Neuroprotection, Neuroregeneration, Immune System, Nervous System, and Digestive System.

By delivering enhanced forms of these ingredients at clinical range dosages, NEUBRIAN™ functions as a 'smart supplement,' designed to unlock your peak performance.

settings.question: What does NeuBrain feel like?
settings.answer:
Unlike conventional supplements that tend to focus only on one or two aspects of brain and body performance, NEUBRAIN™ is a comprehensive optimizer for your entire brain and body. It's formulated to foster an adaptive state of peak performance.

The benefits of NEUBRAIN™ are versatile: In the workspace, it could enhance your multitasking abilities or single-task focus.

When exercising, it may fuel your motivation and drive.

When preparing for an outdoor adventure, it can boost your energy levels to face any challenges ahead.

For learners, it may improve studying capacity and bring calm, clear focus during exams.

In social situations, NEUBRAIN™ may promote relaxation, a brighter mood, and fluid communication skills.

settings.question: What does NeuBrain taste like?
settings.answer:
NEUBRAIN™ was developed to become your new morning ritual, a refreshing alternative to your regular coffee.

We've crafted a medium roast blend with hints of cocoa to not only tantalize your taste buds but also fill your kitchen with a delightful aroma.

NEUBRAIN™ is easy to prepare and provides you with enduring energy throughout the day, minus the jitters, anxiety, or afternoon coffee often associated with regular coffee.

settings.text-1: Free shipping on every subscription order in the USA!
